comments: Take this course as a fifth class. It requires almost no work unless you are preparing for an exam. Also, DO THE WEEKLY REPORTS. You do not want to be marked down for not doing them, when they take at most ten minutes per week.
Harvard perfectionism does not help us here, so relax!
If you are in this class be prepared to reinforce the material on your own.
This class was a great experience. Patrick was a great instructor. The course materials were helpful. Theater night was a fun way to learn about other African languages.
If you know French or some Creole, take it.

very interactive and enthusiastic class; a great way to learn about Haitian culture while learning Haitian Creole; the workload is not difficult and learning the language is a challenge but not too difficult
If you really want to learn haitian creole, do not take it. there is very little work, but it feels like a waste of time
good change from other kinds of courses, chance to learn about a language and culture in an intimate, non-stressful environment
Patrick Sylvain is AMAZING!
Definitely make sure you attend class and do all of the homework.
This was a really fun class, and I learned a good amount.  Very valuable, and the workload is pretty light.
This is a great class! Low work load, if you are having trouble grasping the language just meet with the professor or form a study group. Great as a low stress 5th class.
Anyone who has an interest in Haiti will find this course- and Patrick Sylvain in particular- an invaluable aid.
This class is a great way to learn about the Haitian language and culture whether or not one has any background in the subject matter.
The fact that this program is very small makes it more likely that you'll receive individualized help with elements of the language that might otherwise be lost.
I used to love to encourage people to take African languages, but this will no longer be a course I recommend.

Prof. Sylvain is great.  As long as he is teaching this course I would definitely recommend anyone with an interest in the Haitian language to enroll.  While at times I felt a bit overwhelmed, Prof. Sylvain made himself very accessible to help me catch up to speed... I highly recommend this course.
It's great! You will love it.
It is amazing.

Definitely take it, its a great way to get an introduction to the Haitian language.  The African languages department in general is great, so try taking an African language in general if you would like to take another.

nice elective, low time commitment, nice opportunity to connect with another culture whether or not you are haitian- if it weren't for this class sometimes I would feel completely isolated from the world that is not English-speaking *white American

For those interested in Francophone studies or just in Haiti itself, this class is a fun, easy introduction to the language. Patrick is knowledgeable and really invested in teaching the language. A great senior spring class.
This is a good basis if you are motivated to learn Haitian, but don't expect to come away from the class knowing a lot of the language.
It's a great course, lots of fun, Patrick is a great professor, and you learn a lot!
take it, its fun and relaxing. there's no law that says asian and european languages are the superior languages. millions of people speak these african languages too.
Patrick is phenomenal.  The workload is rather customizable (and light), and he does his best to make it an engaging and relevant experience for his students.
While learning the language you learn a lot about  the history and the culture of Haiti

A low key way to learn a little bit of the Haitian language. Unlike many beginning language classes at Harvard, this class is taught in English rather than immersion style, and the class isn't too intense. If you really want to learn a lot, it will definitely be on you! Regardless, the instructor is very nice and shares a lot of cultural insight.
The Haitian language is very interesting and dynamic, as is the culture and history of Haiti.
If you already understand enough Haitian Creole to read and understand it, I would definitely recommend this class because I learned so many interesting things I never knew about Haiti.
Take if even remotely interested in Haiti.

Haitian Creole is a beautiful language and Patrick Sylvain is a fun and dynamic instructor. If you're interested in learning more about Haiti for any number of reasons, you'd be hard-pressed to find such an engaging introduction to the language elsewhere!

You will never regret taking a class with Patrick Sylvain.  If you put in effort and display a genuine desire to learn Kreyol, this class will allow you to refine your understanding of the language, learn about the underlying grammatical structures, and give you a close look at the etymology of words. Patrick is immensely knowledgeable about Haitian and Caribbean history, so use him as a resource to learn about Haitian culture through the language.  This class is very flexible, and many types of learning are accommodated (audiovisual, speaking, reading).  Patrick cares about good teaching and about his students, and he is a warm, kind-hearted person.  This course is a refreshing change from the more austere Romance Language department (coughFRENCHcough).
If you really like small discussion-based classes, and Haitian Creole/Haiti, of course, you should definitely check this course out.  Patrick is really cool.
Know what you want and be engaged. Structure is loose so you have to have a plan for what YOU want to learn going in.
This is a class where you not only learn the language, you also learn the history and the culture.
It is a great introduction to Haitian Creole but is not as structured of a class as other language courses at Harvard.
Patrick is great, be sure to spend time practicing outside of class & not just studying the language

Patrick is one of the best teachers I have had here. He is warm, engaging, and conscientious. I always look forward going to his class. Learning haitian creole seemed a bit daunting at the start of the semester, but within days of starting the class I felt comfortable with the language and eager to learn more.

This class is awesome. Patrick Sylvain will teach you Haitian Creole effortlessly. Discussion and class participation plays a large part in this class, but it does not feel forced and contrived like in many other classes at Harvard. Definitely take this class. You'll learn a lot more than just Haitian Creole.
Patrick is an excellent Haitian teacher. You'll learn about the language and the culture, from day 1. Very highly recommended!

Haitian Croele is a Great class and Patrick is great. However, if you have never spoken french before or have never been exposed to Creole you need to put in a lot of work on your own. SUch as going over basic vocab like numbers, days of the week, the alphabet, etc. because they won't be taught to to you in class.

This is an awesome class. Not a ton of work, but enough to get the hang of the language. It's only introductory, so don't expect to be fluent after one term. Having a background in french was definitely helpful. Patrick also is very knowledgable about the political and social climate of Haiti. One of my most valuable take-aways was learning a little bit about how life is in Haiti.
Definitely take this course if you have any interest in Haiti, not just the Creole language.  You will learn a great deal and it's fun!

Have some idea of what you're getting into. I had never heard the language before, so catching up to others that had was a little more difficult. However, Patrick was more than accommodating to my pace and made sure I had an understanding before he moved on. Just quite a bit that we were expected to have a solid grasp on.
If you're interested in Haiti, definitely take this course. Not only will you learn the language, but you will probably learn more about the country than any other course offered at Harvard.

Great class overall - not so demanding, yet You actually get to learn a lot and after one semester You are able to sustain basic conversations; You also learn a lot about Haiti and the context of the evolution of the language; Patrick is really energetic and passionate; and You also get to go to a Haitian restaurant at the end of the course!
THis course is fun. Plus you learn alot about Haiti and Creole.

Patrick is a very engaging and accessible instructor and fully integrates Haitian history and culture into his lessons. If you have the slightest interest in Haiti, don't pass up this great opportunity!

Patrick Sylvain is an extremely gifted teacher. Time flies by in the classroom because of the interactive nature of the course and you will learn a lot from your classmates too. I would highly recommend this class to anyone with an interest in Haitian Creole.
Be prepared to adjust to Haitian time, which is a good 10 minutes later than Harvard time!

This class is a hidden gem at Harvard. It is minimal work, but you'll come away with the skills to be able to communicate in Haitian. I plan on going to Haiti this summer, and I am confident that I'll be able to communicate to the residents of Haiti.

Taking Haitian with Patrick has been one of the great experiences of my time at Harvard. The class suffered from diminished meeting time this semester, but I have never picked up a language as quickly and enjoyed it so much as this. Patrick's lessons on contemporary and historical Haitian culture are extremely valuable for providing context for the language.

Taking Haitian Creole has been the best decision I have made at Harvard. Lesly, like Patrick before him, is an extremely gracious instructor with an easy-going personality and a knack for making you feel comfortable in the classroom. Before taking Haitian here, I had no prior experience with the language or culture but now feel as though I have learned an immense amount about both.
This class was a little disorganized. I felt like I didn't have the opportunity to advance my proficiency in Creole as much as I would have liked.
Great intro to Creole, Lesly is an easygoing and fun professor. Really enjoyed the course (despite the weird hours).
Lesly is awesome and it is great to be able to actually ask questions to an expert and get answers right back!
It's great if you want to explore because you learn about the culture as well as the language.
You  get what you put in to this class. Take advantage of the small class size. I really enjoyed it!
If you want to expand your horizons take this class
If you want to learn Creole, definitely take this but don't expect the same level of organization as other language courses. This is much more laid back, which can sometimes get frustrating.

-It was a great corse becuase Lesly is like an open encyopledua he knows so much about the Haitian culture, Ask him anything. Push him to focus on grammar and writing  if that is something you struggle with.
Learn Haitian Kreyol! Very useful in Boston, even if you never go to Haiti.
Very great hands-on learning.
Prof. Lesly is an amazing teacher--be prepared to learn a lot!!

This is truly a remarkable (and easy) class. You really learn Haitian Creole quite quickly, but keeping up isn't ever a problem. Lesly is an amazing teacher who emphasizes listening and speaking from the very beginning, correcting mistakes over the course of the class in both a lenient and encouraging manner. This is a HUGE help to learning the language. The class is a bit disorganized and assignments are sometimes late to come, but this isn't usually a major source of stress. I recommend taking it if you want to have a fun, laid-back class for your schedule and if you really want to learn a language well!
It is a great experience if you are prepared to not have as much structure as the typical language course.
Amazing professor -- really engaged in the material and makes learning fun.
Important if you're planning to work in Haiti or in communities of the diaspora, also if you're interested in creole identity and/or minor/oppressed literatures.

This is a pretty fun class but be prepared for a challenge.The class can be really chill in the beginning but it can get intense. Lesly is really sweet and will really work with you sometimes but sometimes his expectations are a little high for first semester beginners.
It's great! If you have French exposure or background, the course becomes much easier, if not,  studying becomes a little more complicated.

Haitian Creole is truly a hidden gem for Harvard students! The course itself is very easy, very laid back, and also informative about the history of Haiti and the United States. Haitian Creole is also immensely useful in and around Boston (including our own dining halls), since many Haitians work in the area. I would recommend taking it for anyone!!
Be eager/enthusiastic to learn.

Lesly is a really understanding and supportive instructor--he wants you to succeed and will provide you with the necessary support to do so. Learning a new language takes time and commitment so you definitely need to be personally motivated to invest in the process but overall this course was great.

This class is not too much work, but you will learn a lot.  It is pretty intensive, especially given the small class size, and it is also very rewarding to be a part of the greater African Language Program.
It's a lot of fun learning about Haitian culture and learning the language.

This is a really great class. You will learn a lot and Lesly incorporates your interest and feedback into assignments and covered topics. It's a very enjoyable and rewarding experience. You will learn a lot about Haitian Creole, Haiti, Haitian culture, and current events in Haiti.
